search_results.snippet: The politic Polonius, convinced that Hamlet is truly mad, nonetheless recognizes in his speech some "method"that is, a kind of artfulness and order. ... Polonius diagnoses Hamlet's madness as a form of "love-melancholy," considered a full-fledged disease in the Renaissance.
search_results.title: Method in the madness - eNotes Shakespeare Quotes - eNotes.com

search_results.snippet: What Polonius is saying is that, even though Hamlet is talking crazy, it actually makes sense, or it has a "method." Polonius's assertion is ironic because he is right and wrong. Polonius believes Hamlet is acting "mad" because Hamlet's love of Ophelia has driven him to such.
